Posted By: kazenpaus (1/30/2013 4:42:42 AM)

posts.post_content:
@SRSFACE. You say this card is broken. So why should it be a rare? Would it be any less broken if it were a rare or mythic rare? Would you be happier if you had to pay $20 for a copy of this, a card which is clearly competitive? If it is broken, then it shouldn't have been printed at any rarity. The power level of a card should not be determined by its rarity. The reason it sometimes IS, is so they can sell more boosters because people don't want to pay $50 for rare playsets on the secondary market.  
  
I don't think it's broken, but because it's competitive I'm glad it's not a rare. After all, the charm cycle is all uncommon. The downside to this charm is that it's not as flexible as many of the others, as the direct damage and the double strike options will be more or less the same in the decks that want to play this. This means that this charm is less flexible than, say, [Azorius Charm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Azorius Charm), [Izzet Charm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Izzet Charm), [Golgari Charm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Golgari Charm), ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Abl (1/22/2013 5:54:18 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Man this charm is so good. Indestructibility is very relevant, and a great way to stop sweeper effects from ruining your day. At worst it'll usually 1-for-1 as a way of saving a creature, at best it can net big card advantage by making a sweeper one sided. Can also be used as a combat trick, turning a trade into 1-sided victory.  
  
Double-strike has many practical uses - as a combat trick, as a way of getting multiple combat-damage triggers, as some extra damage going through - very practical. If they're tapped out and you've got a solid attacker going through, that double-strike is going to be brutal.  
  
Even the 4 damage, which is always going to be card disadvantage is just fantastic. 2 mana for 4 damage is pretty solid, and in the aggressive colors of Boros it can easily end the game, especially if you're running any other burn. Even in standard, it's not going to be uncommon to go EOT Searing Spear + Boros Charm to finish your opponent.  
  
At \*least\* 4/5.
posts.html:
Man this charm is so good. Indestructibility is very relevant, and a great way to stop sweeper effects from ruining your day. At worst it'll usually 1-for-1 as a way of saving a creature, at best it can net big card advantage by making a sweeper one sided. Can also be used as a combat trick, turning a trade into 1-sided victory.

Double-strike has many practical uses - as a combat trick, as a way of getting multiple combat-damage triggers, as some extra damage going through - very practical. If they're tapped out and you've got a solid attacker going through, that double-strike is going to be brutal.

Even the 4 damage, which is always going to be card disadvantage is just fantastic. 2 mana for 4 damage is pretty solid, and in the aggressive colors of Boros it can easily end the game, especially if you're running any other burn. Even in standard, it's not going to be uncommon to go EOT Searing Spear + Boros Charm to finish your opponent.

At *least* 4/5.

Posted By: SyntheticDreamer (1/22/2013 9:29:29 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
A rare example of an instant that is unequivocally incredible in aggro decks. It can push those last points through against an opponent who thinks they managed to get stable (using the first OR third modes depending on situation, no less!), save you from a board wipe, act as a combat trick to save an important creature (again, using any mode but the first), among other applications. The chances of none of these things coming up are extremely low, meaning this card doesn't fall into the common trap of being a dead card in an aggro hand, which has a nasty habit of reducing your damage juuuust enough that you can't kill the opponent any more.  
  
Also, you can spend six mana for a one-sided [Armageddon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Armageddon). That's gotta count for something.
posts.html:
A rare example of an instant that is unequivocally incredible in aggro decks. It can push those last points through against an opponent who thinks they managed to get stable (using the first OR third modes depending on situation, no less!), save you from a board wipe, act as a combat trick to save an important creature (again, using any mode but the first), among other applications. The chances of none of these things coming up are extremely low, meaning this card doesn't fall into the common trap of being a dead card in an aggro hand, which has a nasty habit of reducing your damage juuuust enough that you can't kill the opponent any more.

Also, you can spend six mana for a one-sided Armageddon. That's gotta count for something.

Posted By: JaxsonBateman (4/14/2013 4:03:36 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Not bad for Commander, this charm. Not the most powerful charm, but pretty good.  
The double strike is the most important part, since it helps your Commander reach the lethal 21+ damage barrier on an opponent much more quickly. Not to mention it also helps as a combat trick, or to trigger "this deals damage / combat damage to a player" abilities twice.  
  
The indestructible part ain't bad either. While it doesn't help vs steal, bounce, shuffle, sacrifice, exile, pacifism like enchantments, clone and similar effects, it's still nice to have around.  
  
The four damage can be used to kill or slow down a planeswalker an opponent controls.
posts.html:
Not bad for Commander, this charm. Not the most powerful charm, but pretty good.
The double strike is the most important part, since it helps your Commander reach the lethal 21+ damage barrier on an opponent much more quickly. Not to mention it also helps as a combat trick, or to trigger "this deals damage / combat damage to a player" abilities twice.

The indestructible part ain't bad either. While it doesn't help vs steal, bounce, shuffle, sacrifice, exile, pacifism like enchantments, clone and similar effects, it's still nice to have around.

The four damage can be used to kill or slow down a planeswalker an opponent controls.

Posted By: borosbeatdown (4/3/2013 12:06:01 PM)

posts.post_content:
This is a definite first pick if you're playing draft (my format of choice), which is why I hardly get to play with this card. Finally got to play it last night as it was in the first pack I opened (passed up a [Realmwright](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Realmwright), no major loss), and by some stroke of luck, I was passed a second one in the third pack. This came in handy when facing another Boros player, who [Act of Treason](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Act of Treason)ed my [Gift of Orzhova](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gift of Orzhova) enchanted [Fortress Cyclops](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fortress Cyclops) and swung for everything, thinking, "No way he could have another Boros Charm."  
  
Got my creature back, I casted Boros Charm, doublestrike and lifelink for 14 damage. GG.
